Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration and Refugee Board erred in assessing credibility
Evidence_Assessment: Arrest history, delay in claiming asylum, religious knowledge, sacrament details
Decision_Outcome: Initial rejection of refugee claim based on lack of credibility
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish credible basis for fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Consistency of testimony, plausibility of explanations, knowledge of religious practices
Legal_Rule: Credibility findings subject to patent unreasonableness standard
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim rejected initially, then remitted for redetermination
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board's approach found unfair in assessing religious knowledge and delays
Key_Evidence_Considered: Details of arrests, timing of asylum claim, knowledge of church sacraments
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee protection system, Charter considerations
Court_Result: Decision set aside, case remitted to differently constituted Board
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on credibility assessments
Evidence_Type: Testimonial, documentary (claim forms, country condition reports)
Remedy_Requested: Allow judicial review, remit for new hearing
Outcome: Judicial review allowed, remitted for redetermination
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative rehearing
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged religious persecution under risk of state and non-state actors
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard in administrative law
